TEXT.TEXTVALUE: The procedure should be conducted in a Laminar Air Flow.
The inoculation loop is heat sterilized in the blue flame of the Bunsen burner till red hot.
The inoculation loop is then allowed to cool for some time.
The conical flask containing bacterial culture is taken from the LAF.
The mouth of the conical flask is then heat sterilized as shown.
With the cooled sterile inoculation loop, a loopful of bacterial culture is taken from conical flask.
The mouth of the conical flask is again heat sterilized & The conical flask containing bacterial culture is then kept in the LAF.
A thin uniform smear of the bacterial culture is then made on the centre of clean glass slide as shown.
The bacterial smear is then heat fixed in the blue flame of the Bunsen burner.
The glass slide is then kept on the staining tray.
The heat fixed bacterial smear is then flooded with crystal violet stain, which acts as the primary stain.
The glass slide is kept undisturbed for 1 minute.
The glass slide is then washed with water to remove the excess stain.
The bacterial smear is then flooded with grams iodine, which acts as the mordent.
The glass slide is kept undisturbed for 1 minute.
It is then washed with water.
The glass slide is tilted and few drops of 95% ethyl alcohol or acetone are added drop by drop for 5 to 10 seconds.
It is then washed with water.
The bacterial smear is then flooded with safranin, which acts as the counter stain & The glass slide is kept undisturbed for 45 seconds.
It is then washed with water to remove the excess stain.
The glass slide is blot dried to remove excess water on it.
It is then placed on the microscopic stage.
The smear is observed under 100X objective and the results are noted.
